div.div: Ἕκτωρ , ορος: Hector, son of Priam and Hecuba, Il. 22.80, 405, 430, Il. 24.747; husband of Andromache, Il. 6.390, Il. 24.723; and father of Astyanax. Hector was the mainstay of Troy in the war, οἶος γὰρ ἐρύ̄ετο Ἴ̄λιον Ἕκτωρ, Il. 6.403. He was slain by Achilles in revenge for the killing of Patroclus, Il. 18.115, Il. 22.326, 331, 361.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
